Detailed Description

The QDMI driver interface.

The purpose of the driver is to connect QDMI device interface implementations to the client interface. The driver is responsible for loading the available devices from their libraries and making them available to the clients. It is also intended to facilitate user management and access control via sessions.

Function Documentation

◆ QDMI_session_alloc()

int QDMI_session_alloc ( QDMI_Session * session)

Allocate a new QDMI session.

The returned handle can be used in subsequent calls to QDMI_session_get_devices to get the devices that are available to the client.

Parameters
[out]sessiona handle to the session that is allocated. The session must be freed by calling QDMI_session_free when it is no longer needed.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the session was allocated successfully.
QDMI_ERROR_OUTOFMEM if memory space ran out.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.

◆ QDMI_session_free()

void QDMI_session_free ( QDMI_Session session)

Free a QDMI session.

This function frees the memory that was allocated for the session. Accessing a (dangling) handle to a device that was attached to the session after the session was freed is undefined behavior.

Parameters
[in]sessionthe session to free.

◆ QDMI_session_get_devices()

int QDMI_session_get_devices ( QDMI_Session session,
int num_entries,
QDMI_Device * devices,
int * num_devices )

Get the devices associated with session.

Parameters
[in]sessionrefers to the session returned by QDMI_session_alloc or can be NULL. If session is NULL, the behavior is implementation-defined.
[in]num_entriesthe number of entries that can be added to devices. If devices is not NULL, num_entries must be greater than zero.
[out]devicesreturns a list of devices found. The QDMI_Device values returned in devices can be used to identify a specific QDMI_Device. If devices is NULL, this argument is ignored. The number of QDMI_Device values returned is the minimum of the value specified by num_entries and the number of devices found.
[out]num_devicesreturns the number of devices found. If num_devices is NULL, this argument is ignored.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the function is executed successfully. Otherwise, it returns one of the following error codes:
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if num_entries is less than or equal to zero and devices is not NULL or if both devices and num_devices are NULL.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an unexpected error occurred.
